conversations.content: My blade's bloomin' like a rose in spring... Now get ready to cool your heels, bub!
Neat as a pin.
You okay there, squirt?
I'm fine. Thank you, ma'am.
Yeah, doesn't look like that chump got any good licks in, so what say we... Huh?
How come you're making that scary face?
Get behind me, squirt, and no dillydally.
(This ain't no fiend—it's something more bloodthirsty. Who in the blazes...?)
Hrk! All right, who's there?!
I should have known a surprise attack was folly against the granddaughter of that doddering old man.
Hot coffee! You're with the Mukuroshu!
Indeed I am. And if you know that, you must also know why I am here.
I would have the scroll from you— the one which reveals the hiding place of the Underworld Key.
Pound sand.
Unfortunate. If you will not surrender the scroll willingly, I will claim it by force.
Nnngh! Damn, that smarts!
(I think this mook's actually aiming for the little squirt there!)
(I ain't gonna be able to close the gap and strike him at this rate...)
Heh heh heh. I don't mind a fight where my opponent remains on the defensive, but how long can you keep it up?
Gyaaah!
Ma'am!
Perhaps I'll take your sword arm first. Hah!
Sakura Flurry!
A Wyrmclan leader?! Im...possible...
Leader of the Boar Wyrmclan Ieyasu
Are you well, Yachiyo?
You're the leader of the Boar Wyrmclan!
Master Ieyasu, if you please.
Ieyasu's Attendant Sazanka
I have disposed of all the Mukuroshu hiding in the vicinity.
He was the last of 'em.
Ieyasu's Pactwyrm Marishiten
Sazanka, would you be so kind as to attend to Yachiyo's wounds?
Of course.
Well, shoot! I feel like the fifth wheel on the ol' apple wagon all of a sudden. How long you been here in Alberia?
We only just arrived.
And the first thing you gotta do is pull my tuchus outta the fire. Sorry about that.
I'm merely relieved to find you well.
I've finished treating your wounds. Fortunately, they were not deep.
Yeah, everything seems jake on this end. I owe you one, pal.
By the way, that little girl...?
I saved her from a fiend, but I think that Mukuroshu cat had designs on her as well.
But she's safe as houses now, thanks to you.
Anyway, I gotta get her back to the village before the sun pulls the ol' switcharoo with the moon.
In that case, Sazanka will accompany you while Marishiten and I call upon the Halidom and offer our greetings.
Understood.
What? Heck no! You gotta be plumb tuckered from all that travel, so take 'er easy for a bit. I'll be fine.
There is no need to refrain on my account. Best to be doubly cautious—and not only to ensure the young lady's safety, yes?
Can't argue with them brass tacks.
Well, the squirt's home safe and sound. Thanks for the assist there, Sazanka.
I was happy to help; I'm only pleased we didn't run across any Mukuroshu pursuers while we made our way back.
By the by, are the Mukuroshu what got you stompin' all the way out here?
Yes. We received word of the attack on the Halidom from Master Seimei's shikigami.
In response, we were dispatched here and told to figure out a solution to the scroll currently in your possession.
The one that leads to the Underworld Key, yeah? So what'd the shogunate say?
As those keys are essential to Hinomoto's survival, they desire all information pertaining to them be held in various locations by reliable guardians.
So if you find it acceptable, they hope you will continue safeguarding your scroll here in Alberia.
Makes more sense than piling 'em all up in one place. Someone could just ransack the joint and have at it.
However, I am opposed to the plan.
Bushwa!
Your grandfather was a senior statesman with the shogunate, but his role has been relinquished, and the connection to it nominally severed.
With no association to our government, there is no need for you to place yourself in danger at our behest.
So I would ask you to refuse this duty and surrender the scroll to Master Ieyasu.
DOUBLE bushwa!
I know you have your own ambitions, but I have no desire for a friend to become embroiled in the shogunate's battles.
Well, I'm tickled that you care so much, but I'm still gonna have to sit down and give all this a think.
I am, of course, well aware the scroll is a memento of your grandfather, and that your decision will not be an easy one.
We are scheduled to depart Alberia in seven days time. I would be grateful if you could make your decision by then.
Yeah, that's fair.
(I wanted to tell her I'd keep it all safe n' sound, but that'd be a bold-faced lie.)
(Heck, I'd probably still be leaking red in the woods if not for them coming along.)
(I keep thinking I'm the bee's knees when it comes to strength, but it's clear I ain't even the bee's ankles yet...)
(Maybe I should let 'em keep grandpappy's scroll safe...)
(I mean, how can I take on his duty if I can't even deal with a single tough...?
What should I do, Grandpappy?
Step up, Taro! You and me are about to go round and round!
Wait! You want to DUEL with me?! But I have no idea what I'm doing!
Greenhorn Samurai Taro
Er, that is to say, as I am still in training, I would be little match for you in a true contest of steel, Yachiyo.
Well then, what if we don't use the ol' pokers? How's that strike you?
So you want to duel...without swords? What kind of duel is that?
A duel of ARMOR POLISHING!
Okay, now I'm very confused.
We both polish fast as the dickens, and the one who hits a mirror shine first walks off with the brass ring! Seems fairer than me putting the hurt on you, eh, pal?
Well, I certainly stand a better chance, but I've already finished taking care of my armor for the day.
Thought that might be the case, which is why I borrowed THIS set of ragamuffin armor from ol' Malka!
You whaaat?!
No reason to turn me down now, chum! So whaddya say? A duel to the dazzle? A battle of brushes? A clean sweep?
Um...sure, I guess?
Cat's pajamas! Now then, on your mark! Get set!
What's going on here?
No time to bump gums, baby! We're in the middle of a duel to see who can get their armor polished up lickety-split.
An...armor-polishing duel?
*scrub* *scrub* *scrub* *scrub* *scrub*
DONE!
Well, I'll be a copper's bunions! We finished at the same time.
Oh, wow. Looks like it's a draw.
No. Taro is the winner.
BUSHWA, SAYS ME!
If you look closely at your visor, Yachiyo, you will find a few unpolished edges.
Well, toss me from the tracks! It's true!
Um, but it's still pretty much all shiny, so I'm okay calling it a draw.
Nope! You gave me the bum's rush fair and square. Can't have a duel without a winner and a loser, after all.
Yachiyo speaks the truth. Bear this victory with pride, Taro.
Your daily diligence in armor polishing is clearly starting to pay off.
Well, my father gave it to me and all, so taking care of it just feels right.
And why, exactly, did you challenge him to this particular contest, Yachiyo?
Ain't it obvious? So I could get even stronger than I am now!
It's like my dear ol' grandpappy said: You ain't the strongest until you best a thousand opponents in a thousand duels.
Yes, I remember him saying that, but I fail to see how it relates to armor polishing.
'Cause I felt like polishing my armor, see?
So I figured making a duel outta it was just more efficient-like.
Efficient how?
Yeah, I don't understand it either—but I DO understand wanting to polish armor.
Whenever I'm lost or worried, polishing my armor makes this curious calm come over me, almost like I'm polishing my heart.
I see.
Incidentally, you've got a really nice suit of armor there, Yachiyo.
You normally dress in the bare minimum of necessary equipment, so I figured you preferred mobility over defense.
My grandpappy gave me this here armor as a gift.
I got no fear of the grave, which means I try to strike palookas fast and hard.
But now that I know the Mukuroshu are behind Grandpappy's death, I thought I'd put this here armor on and have me a little vengeance hootenanny.
A way of thinking very like you.
But based on the way you are speaking, it sounds to me like you do not know who originally gave this armor to you.
Hold it, bub! Are you saying this fine suit here DIDN'T come from Grandpappy?
No. Originally, that armor was a gift from your sister, Momoyo.
Honest, Saiga, I'm a little worried about Yachiyo walking the path of the sword.
She has real talent, but that only makes the chances of her being injured rise.
Have you told her this?
Such worries would do little more than encumber her on the path.
There is no sin in hoping for Yachiyo's safety; do not devalue your love for her.
Thank you, Saiga. In that case, I'm going to give her an unequaled piece of armor that will hopefully keep her safe.
Doing so will help to alleviate my worries while also not causing her any grief.
Your armor is imbued with your sister's love, Yachiyo. That's great!
Alas, she departed this world before she was able to give it to you.
I suspect your grandfather did not inform you of its actual origin in order to spare you any further pain or sadness.
*sniff* I love 'em both to bits...
Why do you aim to grow stronger, Yachiyo?
'Cause it was Grandpappy's greatest wish.
And once you have defeated a thousand souls in duels? What will you do then?
Well, I'm gonna...er...
Momoyo did not carry a weapon as you and I do, but she was strong nonetheless.
She never wore her anxiety or fear openly. She was ever courageous. Stout of heart.
She only sought the strength to watch over us for our sakes.
The strength to watch over us, eh?
You chose the strength of the sword, but for what purpose do you seek it?
Once you come to understand that, you will be able to grow stronger without charging headlong from one duel to the next. You will be given the gift of time.
Oh, that is SO cool! I'm gonna keep trying to get stronger too, so let's make sure we both do the best we can together!
Yeah, let's do that...
(You realized I've been as worried as a long-tailed cat in a room full of rockers lately, didn't you, Saiga?)
(But why do I wanna get stronger...?)
(But why do I wanna get stronger...?)
(For as long as I can remember, I wanted to be the strongest tomato around.)
(But what happens once I do it?)
(I ain't exactly an egghead in the ol' brains department, so I'll be knock-kneed if I got any idea about that one...)
Aw, saltmuffins! I got no clue! No clue, I tells ya!
Gyaaa!
Sazanka!
Er, apologies for my outburst, Yachiyo. You just surprised me when you shouted.
Well, crumbs. Sorry about that. Me and the ol' noggin here were just doing some heavy lifting. Anyway, you need me?
Yes. You recall the little girl we saved from the Mukuroshu?
We received a letter from her family claiming they wished to offer thanks for saving her, and I thought you might come.
Hot potatoes, count me in!
So Ieyasu ain't coming to this shindig?
Master Ieyasu has a conference with members of the Alberian royal family, and has given me a letter of apology to deliver in his stead.
Ieyasu sure stays hopping. Pretty impressive he can still give chumps the ol' one-two despite all a' that paper-pushing he does.
I have heard your grandfather managed a similarly praiseworthy balance of both political work and martial-arts training.
Say, Sazanka? Can I pull on your coat about my grandpappy and the shogunate?
Turns out I don't know bubkes about the work he did as a vassal of the shogunate, or even what went on at the castle.
I only met him a few times, so most of what I know is second-hand, but...
Your grandfather gained the respect of a great many generals as a swordmaster and instructor to the shogun family.
This connection also lead him to serve as instructor for the leaders of the clans— and even Master Ieyasu himself.
Well, I'll be dipped in honey. I had no idea.
Still, how did a sword instructor end up being in charge of an Underworld Key?
It sounds like your grandfather's goal was the impetus for that.
You mean his wantin' to be the strongest swordsman ever?!
Yes. With that in mind, he never idled in his training, even after being given a task as important as teaching a shogun.
That industriousness earned him trust, and he was eventually selected to be the guardian of an Underworld Key.
Can't believe my grandpappy was so dang diligent...
Is it truly so surprising?
When he first told me they made him a vassal, I thought it was baloney. He always did like to yap a big game, after all.
Looking at you, I can imagine that.
Ha! Well, we are two peas in a pod!
Do you know why he left the shogunate?
I recall something about his saying he was leaving in order to protect his family.
I think this was right around the same time he was entrusted with the Underworld Key.
So long as I'm the humdinger in charge of this here Underworld Key, me and mine ain't never gonna be safe.
So what say you hop on the trolley and lemme do my duty at their side from this day forward, eh?
Well, I'll be doggonned...
He loved his family terribly.
From what I hear, he originally aspired to serve as a vassal of the shogun in order to safeguard his family in Hinomoto.
Oh, Grandpappy...
(Everything he did, he did for us...)
(But now he and Momoyo are both pushin' up pansies, so what good is all this power I've been workin' for...?)
Ah, there's the village now.
Her family is just over there.
Oh, you're from the Halidom! Have you seen our daughter Annie?!
Can't say as we have. Why the worry, toots?
She's gone! She was in the house this morning, but now she's just vanished!
Butterbeans! That ain't good!
Let's split up and look for her.
Annie? Where are you, Annie?
(I'm getting a very bad feeling about... Wait! Over there!)
Heh heh heh. Now that we have the bait, all the remains is how to best lay it.
Haaah!
Release that girl at once.
M-ma'am...
Ho, looks like I fished up an attendant of the Boar Wyrmclan! But I'm afraid it's your warrior companion that I'm after. Bring her to me at once.
I cannot do that...
But what I CAN do is end your life! Haaah!
Time to drop some baggage. ...CATCH!
Eeek!
Hold on, Annie! I've got you!
Are you all right?
Yeah... Thank you.
You picked a bad moment for playtime, my friends. Haaaaaah!
Urgh!
Ma'am?! MA'AM!
Listen here, little one: I'm letting you go so you can deliver a very important message.
Well, heck. The sun's already cheesed it, and now Sazanka's gone, too.
Waaaaaah!
Annie!
Hey there, squirt! Good to see you ain't full'a holes! ...Er, but why are you alone?
The other lady is...
She saved me, but the bad man came and took her awaaaay!
What?!
This here's the mountain the Mukuroshu told me to come to...
They kidnapped Sazanka AND used a kid what to lure me here and get the scroll... What a buncha chumps!
Oh, we're quite accustomed to people not understanding us.
Yachiyo! Why are you here?!
Did you come alone and with the scroll as we demanded, warrior?
Whatcha see is whatcha get, pal— though it'd probably be faster to have your secret toadies check if I'm on the level.
You're aware of my clandestine comrades? You are as talented as advertised.
How can I not be? Those cats practically got a bib around their necks with my face on it what to catch all the drool.
Well then, bring the scroll to me at once and we can avoid any unpleasantness.
No, Yachiyo! The scroll is too precious! Take it and run!
Ain't no geegaw in the world worth a friend's life, Sazanka.
Good, yes. That's an obedient lass. Now...
(Now.)
When did you draw...your sword...?
That there's a speedy unsheathing trick courtesy of my grandpappy. Works great on saps like you what think I ain't ready.
Now, Sazanka! Cheese it!
Right!
After them!
*pant* *pant* Sazanka, take this!
The scroll?!
Take it and make for the Halidom— and be sure they send backup!
I'll wait for 'em here and hold 'em off. Better one of us make off with the goods than both of us end up on the wrong side of the dirt!
Then I will be the one to stay!
Leave the rolling around in the mud to a mug like me what loves to duel. Now split!
Good luck to you.
It's in your hands now, Sazanka!
Listen good, ya Mukuroshu rats! From this moment on, this here's a dueling ground! So if you want past me, you're gonna have to send me to the boneyard!
A duel? Oh, but this IS interesting. Very well. We shall duel. However...
We will all duel you at once!
Good! The more of you chumps there are, the stronger I get for bumpin' ya off!
Now let's dance!
*pant* *pant* I see the Halidom!
(Yachiyo, please be okay!)
*pant* *pant*
She's taken out more of us than I thought possible, but she's beginning to tire!
Hraaah!
Nnngh...
Surrender, warrior. Your sword is not enough to stop us, especially when you lack the reason and ambition to wield it.
I ain't gonna stand for that kind of talk from a bunch of mopes like you!
We fight as one because we dream of bringing down the shogunate! We wield our blades to forge a new and better era!
But you have no dreams! No ideology! You're just a sharp sword and a set of fangs cutting down people at random!
Wrong, bub! I fight in order to become the strongest swordswoman ever!
And what do you seek to accomplish once you do?!
(Well, then I'll...)
Hah! An opening!
Aw, hell!
Gaaah!
(Well, this ain't good... Head's all fuzzy... Think I'm slippin' away...)
(Huh? Is this...the old house? Well, I'll be. Guess my life's flashing before my eyes.)
(This...is when I left home on my journey, after I couldn't stop all the awful stuff what went down...)
(Couldn't find a sawbones to cure Momoyo... Couldn't stop Saiga from hitting the bricks...)
(And I couldn't protect Grandpappy... I didn't even know he was in danger!)
(I got all in a tizzy and set out to fulfill his wish, but now I think I just wanted to leave that sap version of myself behind...)
I am prepared.
I will END you!
(Now it's a memory of my duel with the prince! Well, ain't this a kick in the head?)
(In the end, I realized he and me were pals and ended the duel then and there.)
(But WHY did I do that? Feelings got no role in battle, so why...?)
So what say you hop on the trolley and lemme do my duty at their side from this day forward, eh?
(Grandpappy!)
I'm going to give my sister an unequaled piece of armor that will hopefully keep her safe...
(Momoyo!)
(Now I get it. The prince is my friend, which is precious as family. THAT'S why I didn't have the sand what to duel him!)
You chose the strength of the sword, but for what purpose do you seek it?
(I get it now. I know why I've been chasing this crazy dream all these years.)
This one here is wily indeed. Best take her head to be safe.
Right.
Huh?! My sword was stopped!
I finally got a handle on my ambition. I know why I'm seekin' power.
How can she even stand with such a wound?!
Because this blade don't yield!
And because I'm going to become the strongest wielder of it!
Yachiyo!
Ah, Sazanka... Glad you're here for me at the very end...
Yachiyo!
Stand back. I'm going to heal her.
She took out this many Mukuroshu all by herself?
This is all my fault, Yachiyo. I'm sorry.
Stow that talk, sister. All that matters here is that YOU ain't hurt.
(Grandpappy... Momoyo... Saiga...  Thanks for the guidance.)
(I think I've finally found the reason I want to be strong.)
Hmm? Sazanka and Ieyasu?
I'm sorry to interrupt your repose. Are we intruding at a bad time?
No, you're fine. My noggin's done enough spinning around for one day.
How are your injuries?
Fit as a fiddle and ready to foxtrot! I can swing my sword and everything.
Thank you for what you did for me.
I'm the one who owes thanks here! Without you, folks would be fitting me for a wooden overcoat about now.
Master Ieyasu and the others were aware something untoward was going on and were able to deal with it quickly.
*pant* *pant* I see the Halidom!
Sazanka, are you all right?!
So that's how it went down, eh? Still, pretty smart of you to bring Cleo.
An excellent decision by the prince.
Ha! He's smart as paint, that one!
But I don't think you came all this way just to make sure I was still kicking.
Correct. Yachiyo, will you accept the duty of guarding the Underworld Key and the scroll which holds its location?
You betcha, pal.
Then—
'Cept the thing is, protecting the keys falls under the jurisdiction of the shogunate.
In other words, the Wyrmclan leaders are the ones what guard the keys once it all comes out in the wash, yeah?
And if I ain't got the same strength as those clan leaders, you got no business leavin' the job to a sap like me.
Then what will you do?
The only thing I can do...
Ieyasu, I challenge you to a duel!
We'll go toe-to-toe to see if I got the sand what to pull off this job of yours!
Yachiyo, no!
Typically I refrain from such unnecessary conflict.
But in this case, I accept your challenge.
Marishiten? You are there, yes? Please serve as judge of the duel.
Blech. And here I was hoping to avoid work for the day.
Come now, I know you'd never pass up a chance to see some skillful bladework.
Fine, I'll do it. You happy?
Now, Yachiyo. This duel will be a test of your strength—so while you may still be convalescing, I will not hold back.
I wouldn't have it any other way. Now put up your dukes!
En garde!
(Amazing... Yachiyo isn't falling behind Master Ieyasu.)
(But even if the goal of this duel isn't for one fighter to slay the other, there's still a chance for significant injury—or worse.)
(Oh, PLEASE be careful...)
You are indeed my teacher's granddaughter. Your skill is splendid.
That's exactly what I oughta be saying! Dueling a Wyrmclan leader has my head spinning like a jazzman on payday!
I believe you can fulfill my teacher's ambition to become the strongest warrior in the world...
But to what end will you use that strength? What drives you to wield your blade?
Power without ambition breeds disaster, so I would hear your answer.
I'm following the teachings of my sister and my grandpappy!
Teachings?
You know it, pal! Even though it went against what she wanted, my sister kept her eyes peeled to make sure I was safe as houses all the time.
And my grandpappy put his life on the line in order to keep his family safe.
That's what they taught me: Strength is about protecting the ones you love.
And I ain't never gonna let that love disappear from the world!
I'll protect everybody what matters to me!
And YOU'RE wide open, pal! Haaaah!
Master Ieyasu!
Master Ieyasu...?
The match is over. You win, girl.
Hot dang! The dragon's here!
Honestly, Ieyasu. It's not like you to leave yourself wide open like that.
Your neck belongs to me, so don't go sticking it out so carelessly!
Heh... As she battled, I saw a look I haven't seen for many a year on her face.
Splendid, Yachiyo. That gave me ample chance to see your skill with the sword.
Marishiten choosing to assist me serves as proof; you would surely have cut me down without intervention.
You are clearly the right person to inherit my master's duty of protecting the key.
Ieyasu...
What do you think, Sazanka? I know you were rather worried.
I was, yes. But it's different now.
It is the job of friends to push each other, and I believe in Yachiyo's strength.
Sazanka!
Well then. In the name of the leader of the Boar Wyrmclan, I hereby appoint you as the guardian of the Underworld Key.
Be ever steadfast in your duty.
I swear on my blade to protect the Underworld Key!
(Watch over me, everyone, because I've just started to cook...)
(I'm gonna become the cat's pajamas and make sure I'm the strongest ever!)
